summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Darrison Tellez about transforming our stress into blessing! Sometimes life feels like one big fat 'L', right? But Pastor Darrison reminds us that what we perceive as stress might actually be God stretching us for something incredible. Using the story of Mary, he beautifully illustrates how God doesn't just want to deliver us FROM pressure, but wants to prepare us THROUGH pressure. Can you imagine being a teenage girl told you'll give birth to the Savior of the world? Talk about stress! But Mary was scared yet prepared, demonstrating that when God gives a promise, He also gives the power to carry it. Pastor Darrison's key message is that we're not just being stressed out, we're being stretched out - and that stretching is preparing us for a breakthrough we can't even imagine! He powerfully suggests that our breaking point might actually be our breakthrough point. Just like a slingshot needs to be pulled back to launch forward, God is pulling us back to launch us into our destiny. His encouragement? Don't just push through life, let God stretch you. Get ready, because 2024 might just be the year God sends you places you've never been before!
mainPoints: God is stretching you, not just stressing you
Your breaking point could be your breakthrough point
Trust God's process of preparation through pressure

versesMentioned.text: Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink; or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothes?
Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.

Enlarge the place of your tent, stretch out the curtains of your dwellings; do not hold back. Lengthen your cords, and strengthen your stakes. For you will spread out to the right and to the left; your descendants will dispossess the nations and settle in their desolate cities.
So is my word that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.
But whoever drinks the water I give them will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give them will become in them a spring of water welling up to eternal life.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.action: Write down three current stressful situations. Pray over each one, asking God to show you how He might be stretching you through these challenges.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see my current pressures as preparation, not punishment. Give me eyes to see Your work in my life, even when I can't understand it. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.'
Tuesday.focus: Viewing challenges as opportunities for growth
Tuesday.action: List a recent challenge you've faced. Reflect on how this experience might be developing your character or faith.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, transform my perspective on challenges. Help me see them as chances to grow stronger in You, not as obstacles to avoid. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Wednesday.action: Identify an area of your life where you feel stuck or stressed. Spend time journaling about how God might be working in this situation.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I trust that You are working, even when I cannot see. Give me faith to believe You are transforming my challenges. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 4:6-7: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.'
Thursday.action: Practice a 'stress to blessing' exercise. For each stressful thought, immediately follow it with a prayer of thanksgiving.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me to exchange my anxiety for Your peace. Help me to trust Your process and find joy in Your presence. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:17-18: 'For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all. So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but on what is unseen, since what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.'
Friday.action: Create a visual representation of your current struggles, then symbolically release them to God, focusing on the unseen work He is doing.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me see beyond my current circumstances. Strengthen my faith to trust Your unseen work in my life. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal how He has been stretching and preparing you for something greater.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, draw near to me. Show me the ways You are working in my life, even in the midst of stress and uncertainty. I trust Your process. Amen.
